key_points: Former President Donald Trump's lawyers argue he did not incite the US Capitol riot and his impeachment should be dismissed.
Trump's legal team, Bruce Castor and David Schoen, argue that his speech is protected by the First Amendment.
They claim Trump's impeachment lacks due process and is unconstitutional because he is no longer in office.
Trump's lawyers condemn House Democrats' impeachment efforts as political theater and dangerous to democracy.
Trump was impeached on a charge of "incitement of insurrection" after the Capitol was stormed on January 6.
Trump's rally and speech near the White House on January 6 are central to the impeachment charge.
The legal brief suggests that the Capitol riot was preplanned, citing law enforcement reports of potential attacks.
Senate leaders have agreed on a timeline for the impeachment trial, allowing four days for opening arguments.
The decision on calling witnesses, including possibly Trump himself, will be made early next week.
Republican leader Mitch McConnell says the agreed timeline preserves due process for both sides.
